title: Fuso.hp
author: Fuso.hp
content: Since ChatGPT was launched in November last year, this AI technology has created a huge response across the globe.  This technology has gained so much popularity that people are using this technology in almost every field. Any math can be easily solved through this technology, any unknown matter can be easily known through this technology, so there is a lot of doubt in everyone's mind about this technology that this technology will destroy the job market or not?  When asked about this, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said the technology will never destroy the job market. Rather, this technology will solve things that people never know about.  Since all tasks can be solved easily through this technology, this bot system may be used instead of humans in various work fields.  If this technology is used in the workplace, many people will lose their jobs.

comments.author: Lamkuthang
comments.body: If anyone thinks so maybe it's just opinions. indeed what has been created is basically for the convenience of us working too. Our real task here and should be to appreciate what the OpenAI Team has tried to create this technology for mankind and use it wisely. I am sure that if there is a gap in terms of operations there will be further development from them.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: No one needs a soothsayer to know that AI generally has its good part and also has its disadvantageous part and will surely deprive people of jobs if care is not taken. With the world's population increasing daily, it's paramount to know that more jobs would be needed daily and the effect would be more pronounced if AI is allowed to do too much of human jobs. The effect might however at times be unnoticed just like the way ATM machines took over the work of many people unnoticed. But if carelessly implemented/allowed, it would really be a threat to the labour market.Nonetheless, I believe that AIs are still in their initial stages, and as people/countries clamour for developments and do not want to take the backbeat in this, they would still leave them to practically ascertain these effects (good or bad). It's after then that I believe regulators would allow some, and clamp down on many for the betterment of all.

comments.body: there are two possibilities.1. Chatgpt is absolutely destroying the freelance market especially designers and programmers.2. comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: There have been mixed opinions on this since Chatgpt was launched. But so far, it's all hypothetical and there hasn't been any evidence that AI will increase unemployment instead of creating more jobs. In my opinion, AI will definitely have an impact on employment and many people will be unemployed. But that will make us more developed and people will find ways to adapt to everything, maybe when AI develops more there will be many other professions and we will have more choices. After all, AI is also created by humans, we are still one level above it.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Artificial intelligence will affect the job market and bring changes, but it will not destroy the Job market. It will make some professions and skills more relevant for the future and some other professions and skills outdated. As someone who is concerned for themselves, if you are in the Job Market, since Artificial intelligence has not yet fully matured, you have to be able to tell if you fall into the category that will loose their jobs to these Artificial intelligence or the category that artificial intelligence will make better. If your job is threatened, now is still a good time to become more relevant by improving on your skills or degree in profession so you are not served out of the job market when Artificial intelligence begin to restructure the Job market.

comments.body: If various work field, that once belongs to humans, and can he please tell us where those people are going to be replaced once the AI takes over? I don't believe this crap claim because it's obvious that those humans won't be needed anymore. Once the inflation problem begins, many companies start sending their workers home, right? Imagine if AI replaces those workers, who will benefit the most? The CEO and co isn't it? They won't have to pay salaries to AI and inflation won't affect them much compared to when they are still paying humans. Sorry I am looking at the bigger picture, I refuse to accept.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Fuso.hp on May 29, 2023, 06:08:17 AMWhen asked about this, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said the technology will never destroy the job market. Rather, this technology will solve things that people never know about.  Since all tasks can be solved easily through this technology, this bot system may be used instead of humans in various work fields.  If this technology is used in the workplace, many people will lose their jobs.It has been estimated that artificial intelligence will cause about 300 million full-time jobs loss. Recently IBM boss Arvind Krishna stated that the company will replace 7,800 workers with AI. Amazon, Meta, Dropbox, and Microsoft are all investing heavily in artificial intelligence technologies that will equally make them shift some job functions to bots which will reduce the human workforce. But some economists believe that AI technology will also create more jobs. Every new invention will make some workers obsolete and create more jobs for others. Secondly, these artificial intelligence tools will have to be supervised by humans, so man is still indispensable. AI tools will be effective in carrying out routine tasks and might not be able to reason and handle issues based on specific situations or circumstances. This means humans will always be around because of their ability to reason and be emotional. The best any worker would do is acquire skills that will help him utilize AI tools to make the job simple and effective. Every worker should learn how AI will affect and advance the job specification.

comments.body: Quote from: Fuso.hp on May 29, 2023, 06:08:17 AMSince ChatGPT was launched in November last year, this AI technology has created a huge response across the globe.  This technology has gained so much popularity that people are using this technology in almost every field. Rather, this technology will solve things that people never know about.  Since all tasks can be solved easily through this technology, this bot system may be used instead of humans in various work fields.  If this technology is used in the workplace, many people will lose their jobs.When machines were initially discovered, their innovative capabilities were divided into different parts, aiding humans in making their work more efficient and faster. Surprisingly, instead of causing job losses for humans, these machines have actually made their tasks easier. Similarly, I believe that ChatGPT will bring about similar outcomes. It will assist humanity in research and development, contributing to advancements and improvements.Moreover, bots have been in existence for several years even prior to the introduction of this technology. Bots have played huge role in aided programmers in accomplishing complex and laborious tasks that would have otherwise been challenging for them. Hence, I have doubts regarding whether this technology will pose a roadblock for the job market.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: ChatGPT could destroy the current job market, especially if ChatGPT develops even more advanced because not many workers can improve their work skills and be promoted in the company.But if ChatGPT can be used well in many companies by working side by side with workers, I don't think it will happen because workers and ChatGPT will help each other to get the job done. But for other companies, some may lay off their workers because ChatGPT can replace their jobs.If the workers are given the opportunity to improve their abilities, I think they will use it so they don't get laid off from their jobs. And let's just hope that the company listens to workers' demands and pays attention to them.

comments.author: DrBeer
comments.body: Quote from: Fuso.hp on May 29, 2023, 06:08:17 AMSince ChatGPT was launched in November last year, this AI technology has created a huge response across the globe.  This technology has gained so much popularity that people are using this technology in almost every field. Rather, this technology will solve things that people never know about.  Since all tasks can be solved easily through this technology, this bot system may be used instead of humans in various work fields.  If this technology is used in the workplace, many people will lose their jobs.A similar situation was when the steam engine appeared Everyone decided that now there will be no manual labor (which was about 99%), there will be no horse traction (which also gave 99% of all transportation). From reality - yes, only horse-drawn carts were massively replaced, because. the steam engine turned out to be just much more efficient and profitable ...... then there was a transition to an internal combustion engine, and there was hysteria - what to do with the miners, the economy would collapse, ...And many many times we experienced "machines will replace people"! These are all turns of evolution and technological progress. So it was, so it is, so it will be!Perhaps some part, and the most inefficient one, will be replaced by AI, but there will be no massive layoffs.There is also a global deterrent: if, for example, we simulate a situation where AI, conditionally tomorrow, replaced 85% of all workers in all industries. What will happen?COLLAPSE.I explain why - a huge number of people will remain on the street without income, and these are CONSUMERS AND BUYERS of goods and services. The question is who will buy and consume? Without this, no economy will work! Both AI and mega technology companies will be left without markets, which will lead to their collapse. There will always be a balance and some kind of natural selection.

comments.author: Fortify
comments.body: Quote from: Fuso.hp on May 29, 2023, 06:08:17 AMSince ChatGPT was launched in November last year, this AI technology has created a huge response across the globe.  This technology has gained so much popularity that people are using this technology in almost every field. Rather, this technology will solve things that people never know about.  Since all tasks can be solved easily through this technology, this bot system may be used instead of humans in various work fields.  If this technology is used in the workplace, many people will lose their jobs.Like many new technologies that are super hyped, I'm not sure this will be as successful as it is being made out to be. There are definitely certain scenarios where AI could *assist* people in getting the right answers or automating certain processes, but they will often rely on people as backup. That being said, it could put certain jobs out of business entirely, for example brokerages like insurance - they will be able to cover every scenario to find the cheapest coverage options without any person interaction, or maybe even travel agents (where they still exist) can definitely be replaced. It's hard to gauge the full impact of it at the moment because there are some many possibilities but it will run into problems too.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: What do you mean by "the job market"? Certain professions are going to be replaced by AI, while others won't be impacted at all.All the ghost writers, copywriters, article writers might be having a hard time competing with AI tools like Chatgpt.The same thing applies to all web designers, photographers and artists. They can't compete with Midjourney and other image generating AI tools.On the other hand, Chatgpt can't mow your lawn, clean your house or repair your car. Maybe in the future, the robots will become so advanced that they will do physical labor, but this will happen probably after several decades(if the human civilization survives World War III).
